value.dsc: FuhQuake hides the authentication crc in f_version responses.
FuhQuake show you the authentication crc in f_version responses.

item.name: cl_fp_messages
item.desc: This variable is used in conjunction with the variable "cl_fp_persecond" to define when the floodprot protection should be triggered (if "cl_floodprot" is set to "1").

item.name: cl_fp_persecond
item.desc: This variable is used in conjunction with the variable "cl_fp_messages" to define when the floodprot protection should be triggered (if "cl_floodprot" is set to "1").

item.name: cl_parseFunChars
item.desc: 0Off. 1You can use Ocrana LED's by hand right out of the console and chat anonymously through "$\" without showing your name (chat messages that are seen without your name at the beginning). Full list: $R - red lamp $G - green lamp $B - blue lamp $Y - yellow lamp $\ - carridge return $( - big left bracket $= - big equal sign $) - big right bracket $. - red middle dot $, - white dot (names only) $< - small left bracket $- - small equal sign $> - small right bracket $a - big grey block $: - line feed $b - filled red block $d - right pointing red arrow $[ - gold left square bracket $] - gold right square bracket $^ - white ^ (names only) ^x - red x (names only) $0-9 - yellow number $xyy - char with hex code yy (In order to use the lamps, you'll need the Ocrana pak).

value.dsc: You can use macros such as %a %h %l (like in Qizmo).

item.name: cl_parseWhiteText
item.desc: Convert text between { and } to white or not in chat/team chat. 0Convert none. 1Convert all (chat and team chat). 2Convert team chat only.

item.name: ignore_flood_duration
item.desc: You can change the 4 second cooldown with the 'ignore_flood_duration' variable.

item.name: ignore_mode
item.desc: Someone is on your ignore list, you won't see any mm1 messages from them (even if they are a spec). 0Ignore say only. 1Ignore say_team too.

value.dsc: Ignore spec chat unless you are a spectator.
Ignore spec chat even if you are a spectator.
Backs up your old config before overwriting it with cfg_save.

item.name: cfg_legacy_exec
item.desc: 0Do not execute config.cfg and frontend.cfg in gamedir ever. 1Execute config.cfg and frontend.cfg in gamedir (unless gamedir = qw) like qw 2.33. 2Execute config.cfg and frontend.cfg even if gamedir = qw. 3Execute config.cfg and frontend.cfg even if gamedir = qw. If there is no config.cfg or frontend.cfg in gamedir, and gamedir != qw then try executing config.cfg and frontend.cfg in qw.

item.name: cfg_legacy_write
item.desc: 0Will not write config.cfg. 1Will write a small config.cfg to your gamedir when quitting just like qw 2.33.

item.name: cfg_save_cmdline
item.desc: 0Won't save command line. 1Writes your command line in configs made with cfg_save (commented out of course).

item.name: cfg_save_sysinfo
item.desc: Not implemented yet.

item.name: cfg_save_unchanged
item.desc: 0Makes cfg_save only write variables that are not default valued to the config file. 1Makes cfg_save write all variables to the config file.

item.name: cfg_save_userinfo
item.desc: 0Makes cfg_save not save userinfo variables. 1Makes cfg_save save all userinfo variables except spectator/name/topcolor/bottomcolor/skin/team . 2Makes cfg_save save all userinfo variables like name/team/teamcolor/rate/msg/skin/w_switch/b_switch/... . Note :'cfg_save_userinfo 1' is best for teamfortress so you don't get kicked for changing bottom color. Note : cfg_save will never save the password variable, even though technically it is a userinfo variable.

item.name: cl_chatmode
item.desc: Console chat mode. 0Text in the console is always treated as a command and in order to chat you have to use messagemode/messagemode2 or use the say/say_team commands. 1Everything you type in the console goes into chat, in order to issue a command, prefix it with a slash (/). 2If the first word in the line is a command, it is executed, otherwise the line is sent as chat.

value.dsc: Messages stay even when you toggle console.
Messages won't say when you toggle console.

item.name: con_notifylines
item.desc: This variable sets the number of notify lines (default 4, max 20) to be used at the top of the screen. 0Use no notify lines at all. 1Use one notify line. ... 20Use 20 notify lines.

item.name: con_notifytime
item.desc: How long console messages stay on screen.

item.name: cvar_viewdefault
item.desc: When you type a cvar name into console (like 'gl_gamma' or 'r_rocketlight'), FuhQuake will tell you the default value of the cvar. 0Off. 1On.

item.name: gl_consolefont
item.desc: In older versions of FuhQuake (v0.30 and lower), FuhQuake looked for an image called charset.png (or .tga) and if it found it then that was made to be your console font. Starting from FuhQuake v0.31, you can change your console font from within FuhQuake. Put all your charset images in qw/textures/charsets/*.png (and *.tga) and use /gl_loadcharset XXX to load XXX.png (or tga). "/gl_consolefont original" will restore the 8bit font in your gfx.wad (this is default). Note: Loadcharset is shortcut for gl_consolefont.

item.name: gl_smoothfont
item.desc: Smoothens out the font (which = good). But in some cases the font wasn't designed to be smoothened (sometimes the case of custom console fonts etc). 0Off. 1On.

item.name: log_dir
item.desc: The logging dir.

value.dsc: Will convert all non printable characters to printable characters in your log. This makes your log readable because all the weird ascii characters that usually occur because of different coloured text in FuhQuake (and because of weird symbols - ocrana led's etc) are converted into printable characters.

item.name: scr_conspeed
item.desc: This variable controls the speed at which the console screen scrolls up and down.

item.name: scr_printspeed
item.desc: This variable controls how fast the text is displayed at the end of the single player episodes.

item.name: cl_crossx
item.desc: This variable allows you to move the position of the crosshair on the X-axis by the specified amount of pixels.

item.name: cl_crossy
item.desc: This variable allows you to move the position of the crosshair on the Y-axis by the specified amount of pixels.

item.name: crosshairalpha
item.desc: This command regulates crosshair transparency, you can use any value from "0" to "1". 0Transparent crosshair. 1Opaque crosshair.

item.name: crosshaircolor
item.desc: This variable defines the color of the crosshair.

item.name: crosshairimage
item.desc: To load the crosshair in FuhQuake use "crosshairimage image_name" where 'image_name' is the name of the crosshair image you put in the above directory. Example, if I have c:\quake\fuhquake\crosshairs\cross.png I'd use "crosshairimage cross" to load it.

item.name: crosshairsize
item.desc: Basically crosshairsize scales the size of the crosshair. Example: crosshairsize 0.5 halves the size and crosshair 2 doubles it.

item.name: cl_demopinginterval
item.desc: How often to request ping updates when recording demos. This variable doesn't affect ping updates when the scoreboard is shown (they are always one update per 2 seconds). 0Disable automatic ping requests.

item.name: cl_demospeed
item.desc: Controls the speed of demo playback in percentage (can be changed during demo playback if you wish).

item.name: demo_capture_dir
item.desc: Change the default capture directory.

item.name: demo_capture_fps
item.desc: Change the default capture fps.

item.name: demo_capture_steadycam
item.desc: Changes behaviour of keyboard/mouse input when capturing.

item.name: demo_dir
item.desc: Change the demos and autorecord directory.

item.name: qizmo_dir
item.desc: Change the default qizmo directory.

item.name: cl_maxfps
item.desc: This variable sets the maximum limit for frames-per-second.

value.dsc: Rotating models bob up and down like in Quake3.
Own's flash off, all other on.

item.name: cl_trueLightning
item.desc: Smoothes out shaft movement, 0 means no smoothing at all, 1 - 100% smoothing; a value of about 0.5 is recommended for modem players.

item.name: gl_caustics
item.desc: The underwater waves (multi-texturing is required for this variable) 0Off. 1On.

item.name: gl_detail
item.desc: Turns on/off fine detailed textures. 0Off. 1On (Looks awesome, but you will take a giant FPS hit if you don't have a good video card).

item.name: r_drawentities
item.desc: This variable can be used to disable that any object entities are drawn. This command is useful to map authors who wish to take a look at their map without drawing any objects such as lifts, buttons, platforms or items. 0Display no entities. 1Display all entities.

item.name: r_explosionLightColor
item.desc: Determines the colour of the explosion light. 0Normal 1Red 2Blue 3Purple 4Green 5White 6Random

value.dsc: Enable smoothing (watch people moving in mvd demos with cl_demospeed 0.1).
No fix for interpolated muzzle flashes.
Powerup glow is turned off on all players.
Disables the powerup glow from yourself only.
Turn off dynamic lighting of rockets.
Turn on dynamic lighting of rockets.

item.name: r_rocketLightColor
item.desc: Determines the colour of the rocket light. 0Normal 1Red 2Blue 3Purple 4Green 5White

item.name: cl_anglespeedkey
item.desc: This variable sets multiplier by which your "cl_yawspeed" (how fast you turn) is multiplied when running (+speed).

item.name: cl_backspeed
item.desc: This allows you to set your backward speed. Obviously this is also limited by the server, usually to "320".

item.name: cl_forwardspeed
item.desc: This allows you to set your forward speed. Obviously this is also limited by the server, usually to "320".

value.dsc: QW compatibility where the keypad keys act the same key name, eg KP_8 acts like uparrow would.
You will be able to bind such keys as capslock, numlock, and all numpad keys.

item.name: cl_movespeedkey
item.desc: This variable is the multiplier for how fast you move when running (+speed) in relation to when walking (-speed).

item.name: cl_pitchspeed
item.desc: This variable determines how fast you you turn up/down when using "+lookup" and "+lookdown".

item.name: cl_sidespeed
item.desc: This allows you to set your strafe speed. Obviously this is also limited by the server, usually to "320".

value.dsc: Will convert +jump commands to +moveup commands when underwater.

item.name: cl_upspeed
item.desc: This allows you to set the speed with which you move up and down in liquids or in spectator mode. Obviously this is also limited by the server, usually to 320*0.7 = 224 when underwater and to 500 in spectator mode.

item.name: cl_yawspeed
item.desc: This variable defines how quickly you turn left (+left) or right (+right).

item.name: freelook
item.desc: 0Both -mlook and freelook 0 must be specified to disable free look mode. 1Enables free look mode, that is, moving the mouse forward and back moves your view direction up or down.

item.name: lookspring
item.desc: This variable toggles the centering of the screen after the -klook command. 0Disable automatic force_centerview. 1Enable automatic force_centerview.

item.name: lookstrafe
item.desc: This variable toggles the automatic strafing when the +klook command is used. When set to "1" and the player used the +klook command, the keys that are bound to the +left and +right commands will now act as if they were bound to +moveleft and +moveright. This command was put it in order to allow keyboard player to combine the +strafe and +klook commands into one. This command also has effect on the mouse controls. When set to "1" moving the mouse left and right will make the player move left and right instead of making him turn left and right.

item.name: sensitivity
item.desc: This variable sets the sensitivity of the mouse, it is one of the most important variables in the whole game.

item.name: m_accel
item.desc: Sets mouse acceleration like in q3.

item.name: m_filter
item.desc: This variable toggles mouse input filtering. When set to "1", the values which are received from the mouse's input will first be averaged together and then that value will be used in the game. The reason for this command is that some mice had problems with sending sporadic coordinates which make the input from the mouse jerky, also when using a serial or PS/2 mouse, the Windows operating system will only sample mouse input every 25ms, that is 40 times a second (for USB mice the sample rate is 125 Hz, that is every 8 ms). When set to "1" this variable will smooth out the input but it will cause latency between the movement of the mouse and the actual response in the game. When using a PS/2 mouse it is thus first recommended to try to increase the sampling rate either by changing it via your mouse driver or by using the ps2rate program which can be downloaded at ps2rate homepage . If you are playing the game at frame rates above 40 FPS and if you can't increase the sampling rate of your PS/2 rate or if you are playing with a serial mouse it is recommended that you enable this toggle.

value.dsc: If you have problems to get MWHEELUP and MWHEELDOWN working set this to 1.

item.name: m_forward
item.desc: This variable controls how fast the player should move forward and back when the mouse is moved forward and back. This command has no effect if the +mlook command is in effect because when the mouse is moved forward and back the player looks up and down instead of moving forward and back. Some players might want to set this variable to "0" if they happen not to use +mlook constantly and they only want to use the mouse to turn the player. Setting this variable to "0" will prevent the inadvertent movement of the player forward and back while trying to make precise turns with the mouse.

item.name: m_pitch
item.desc: This variable sets the level of precision when the mouse is used to make the player look up and down while the +mlook command is in effect. By default this variable is set in such a way that moving the mouse forward makes the player look up and moving the mouse backward makes the player look down. Some people prefer to have this movement inverted just like it is inverted for airplane controls. If you wish to use this inverted mouse movement then you should set this variable to a negative value (for example "-0.022"). It is a matter of preference which movement method is used by players. Also lowering the value for this variable will increase the level of precision when the mouse is used to make the player look up and down. This variable can be used separately from the sensitivity variable to provide greater control over the mouse sensitivity for movement along the pitch. It is advisable to keep the value for this variable constant at 0.022 or -0.022 and instead use the sensitivity variable to change the overall sensitivity of the mouse. Also, some script writers lower the value for this variable along with a lowered value for the fov variable in order to provide more precision when the fov variable is used to zoom.

item.name: m_rate
item.desc: This variable should be set to your mouse rate (in Hz). Note: need -m_smooth and -dinput to commandline.

item.name: m_showrate
item.desc: 0Disable 1Print current mouse rate Note: need -m_smooth and -dinput to commandline.

item.name: m_side
item.desc: When the +strafe command is active or when "lookspring" is set to "1" this variable is used to control the sensitivity when the mouse is moved left and right to make the player move left and right.

item.name: m_yaw
item.desc: This variable controls how fast the player turns left and right when the mouse is moved left and right. It is recommended that this variable be left alone and instead the "sensitivity" variable is used to change the level of precision. If you set this variable to a negative value you will reverse the mouse movement. Some script writers use this variable to increase the level of precision when the "fov" variable is used to zoom the screen.

item.name: tp_name_axe
item.desc: Customizes item

item.name: tp_name_sg

item.desc: Customizes item

item.desc: Customizes item

item.desc: Customizes item

item.name: tp_name_separator
item.desc: Customizes item

item.name: tp_need_rl
item.desc: Customizes the %u macro

item.name: tp_need_weapon
item.desc: Customizes the %u macro

item.name: tp_need_ga
item.desc: Customizes the %u macro

item.name: tp_need_ya
item.desc: Customizes the %u macro

item.name: tp_need_ra
item.desc: Customizes the %u macro

item.name: tp_need_shells
item.desc: Customizes the %u macro

item.name: tp_need_nails
item.desc: Customizes the %u macro

item.name: tp_need_rockets
item.desc: Customizes the %u macro

item.name: tp_need_cells
item.desc: Customizes the %u macro

item.name: tp_need_health
item.desc: Customizes the %u macro

value.dsc: Might give you a couple more fps.
Enable "fullbright" colors on bsp models (World, health boxes, etc).
Might also give you more fps.
Enable "fullbright" colors on alias models (grenades, player models, etc).
Use proper lighting for light sources (powerups etc.).
Just draw a shaded ball of the color of the light.
Makes the map lighter, but fulbrights don't look as good.
Makes the map darker, but makes fullbrights stand out more (looks better).

item.name: r_ambient
item.desc: This variable controls the amount of ambient lighting on the map. When this variable is increased the map will become brighter and all walls and objects will be rendered in a lighter color. It was removed in QWCL and has been re-introduced in FuhQuake now, however it can only be used when the server is running with cheats enabled (for example "qwsv -cheats"), because it could be used as a cheat by making it easier to see players in dark corners when no fullbright skins are used.

item.name: r_fullbright
item.desc: 0Do not fullbright the map. 1Enable fullbright display of the map. This variable toggles the use of lights at full brightness on the map. When this variable is set to "1" the renderer system will render all textures on the map at full brightness. This will allow map authors to remove all of the lighting effects from the map. This variable was removed in QWCL and has been re-introduced in FuhQuake now, however it can only be used when the server is running with cheats enabled (for example "qwsv -cheats"), because it could be used as a cheat by making it easier to see players in dark corners when no fullbright skins are used.

value.dsc: Disable light sources on the map.
Enable light sources on the map.
Do not display shadows for entities.

item.name: Match
item.desc: Read match tools readme.

item.name: cl_warncmd
item.desc: 0Disable the unknown command messages. 1Enable the uknown command messages. Note: Not saved to config with cfg_save command.

item.name: watervis
item.desc: This server-side cvar is mirrored to serverinfo as a hint to clients on whether the server is using the so-called watervised maps. 0No watervis. 1GLQuake users can see through water if they set r_wateralpha to a value < 1. It's a bad idea to use watervis 1 if the maps the server is using are not watervised. Water will appear 'transparent' but you won't be able to see any items/players/etc through it. And it is a bad idea anyway because Quake maps were not designed for transparent water; enabling it changes gameplay, decreases fps and produces more network traffic and puts non-GL players at a disadvantage because the software renderer doesn't support transparent water (yet). Not saved to config with cfg_save command.

item.name: MP3
item.desc: Read mp3 readme.

item.name: cl_c2sImpulseBackup
item.desc: Used with cl_c2spps, it controls how many backup copies of packets with non-zero impulses are to be sent to the server. The recommended value is 3, but you can try 2 or even 1 to reduce traffic if you don't have any packet loss.

item.name: cl_c2spps
item.desc: Packet filtering (a la Qizmo's .c2spps command). Use this to reduce network traffic if you're playing on a 28800 (or worse) connection and can't set cl_maxfps 72 because it causes lags.

item.name: cl_nodelta
item.desc: Control the network packet delta compression. When you get blue lines in your netgraph, you should set 'cl_nodelta 1'. 0Enable delta compression. 1Disable delta compression.

item.name: cl_nopred
item.desc: This variable toggles client-side jump prediction. Unless you are having problems this variable should be left at "0". 0Enable jump prediction. 1Disable jump prediction.

value.dsc: Disable the new PL calculation algorithm.
Enable the new PL calculation algorithm.

item.name: cl_predictPlayers
item.desc: This toggles the prediction for other players' movement. Unless you are having problems this variable should be left at "1". 0Do not predict other players' movement. 1Predict other players' movement.

value.dsc: When you run into other players you will appear to clip in them.
When you run into other players they will appear to be solid.

item.name: cl_timeout
item.desc: This variable defines the timeout value in seconds until the client considers himself to be disconnected from the server.

value.dsc: You won't drop from qizmo if you are using connect, join and observe commands.

item.name: gl_affinemodels
item.desc: Makes texture rendering quality better if set to 1. Note: 3dfx thing, not sure. //fuh check this.

item.name: gl_clear
item.desc: This variable will toggle the clearing of the screen between each frame. This can be helpful when specing a game and flying out of the map and during map development when the map maker must fly outside of the map to look has his map from the outside. Enabling this toggle will clear the areas which are not rendered outside of the map thus preventing the flickering effect when images repeat themselves over and over. However it causes problems when playing and going through the surfaces of a liquid (for example when diving into water), as you will see a red flash where the liquid texture would normally be repeated. 0Off. 1On.

item.name: gl_clearColor
item.desc: Sets clear color (gl_clear 1)

item.name: gl_cull
item.desc: This variable toggles the use of internal OpenGL functions for removing covered objects. When this variable is set to "1" the game will depend on the OpenGL driver to use it's culling functions to remove certain objects from the calculations because they are covered up and would not be seen anyways. It is a good idea to leave this toggle enabled because it will increase rendering performance. 0Do not use culling to increase rendering performance. 1Use the OpenGL driver's culling functions.

item.name: gl_finish
item.desc: This variable toggles the calling of the gl_finish() OpenGL function after each rendered frame. 0Do not call the gl_finish() function after each frame. 1Call the gl_finish() function after each frame.

value.dsc: Do not smooth the textures on models.

item.name: gl_triplebuffer
item.desc: Triple buffering of video memory related stuff (Triplebuffer = good). 0Off. 1On.

item.name: gl_ztrick
item.desc: This variables toggles the use of a trick to prevent the clearning of the z-buffer between frames. When this variable is set to "1", the game will not clear the z-buffer between frames. This will result in increased performance but might cause problems for some display hardware. 0Do not use the z-buffer trick. 1Use the z-buffer trick.

item.name: r_farclip
item.desc: Can be used to overcome vision being limited to 4096 units in GL clients (good for xpress2 etc).

item.name: gl_bounceparticles
item.desc: 0Disable. 1Controls whether sparks rebound off walls. Bouncing particles look nicer, but may eat up CPU.

value.dsc: this will limit the number of blended particles close to you. This gives a big FPS increase when blended particles take up a big proportion of your screen and challenge your video card's fillrate.
Determines particles used for blob explosions (EMP's)
Determines particles used for blood effects.
Determines particles used for pyro flames in TF.
Determines particles used for lava splashes (Spy Gren).
Determines particles used for spikes (nailgun etc).
Determines particles used for teleport splashes.
Determines particles used for (rocket etc) trails.
Might make tele particles faster for 3dfx wicked gl drivers.

item.name: bottomcolor
item.desc: Sets the pants color.

item.name: b_switch
item.desc: This variable allows you to define the highest weapon that FuhQuake should switch to upon a backpack pickup. The possible arguments of "b_switch" refer to the impulse that is used to switch to a certain weapon: 1Axe 2Shotgun 3Double-Barreled Shotgun 4Nailgun 5Super Nailgun 6Grenade Launcher 7Rocket Launcher 8ThunderBolt

item.name: name
item.desc: Player's name.

item.name: noaim
item.desc: This variable toggles whether a server-sided aiming-help should be used when shooting rockets (not possible when the server variable "sv_aim" is set to "0"). 0Enable server-side aiming help for rockets (if allowed by the server). 1Disable server-side aiming help for rockets.

item.name: rate
item.desc: Sets the maximum amount of bytes per second that the server should send to the client.

item.name: skin
item.desc: Sets the skin name for the player.

item.name: team
item.desc: Set the team name.

item.name: topcolor
item.desc: Sets the shirt color.

item.name: w_switch
item.desc: This variable allows you to define the highest weapon that FuhQuake should switch to when picking it up. The possible arguments of "w_switch" refer to the impulse that is used to switch to a certain weapon: 1Axe 2Shotgun 3Double-Barreled Shotgun 4Nailgun 5Super Nailgun 6Grenade Launcher 7Rocket Launcher 8ThunderBolt

item.name: cl_bonusflash
item.desc: Controls weapon and item pickup flash. 0Off. 1On.

item.name: gl_cshiftpercent
item.desc: This variable sets the percentage value for palette shifting effects (damage flash, powerup blend).

item.name: gl_hwblend
item.desc: 0OpenGL routines. 1Hardware palette changing. Note: 1 can be slow on wintNT/2K.

value.dsc: Disable palette shifting when submerged or poweruped.
Enable palette shifting when submerged or poweruped.
Off (no palette shifting when you're in liquid).
On (palette shifts when you're in liquid).
Turns off light blend when you're inside a light bubble (with gl_flashblend 1).
Turns onn light blebd when you're inside a light bubble (with gl_flashblend 1).

item.name: v_pentcshift
item.desc: Flash coefficient for when you take the pent.

item.name: v_quadcshift
item.desc: Flash coefficient for when you take the quad.

item.name: v_ringcshift
item.desc: Flash coefficient for when you take the ring.

item.name: v_suitcshift
item.desc: Flash coefficient for when you take the suit.

value.dsc: Shows the time you spent on server (you'll also see it in the status bar when you press TAB).

item.name: cl_clock_x
item.desc: Horizontal coordinates of the clock.

item.name: cl_clock_y
item.desc: Vertical coordinates of the clock. If < 0, the coordinates are calculated from bottom up, e.g. -1 means the screen line just above the scoreboard.

item.name: cl_democlock
item.desc: A clock showing how much time has elapsed since the start of the demo. 0Off. 1On.

item.name: cl_democlock_x
item.desc: Determine where the democlock is positioned on your screen on the X co-ordinate.

item.name: cl_democlock_y
item.desc: Determine where the democlock is positioned on your screen on the Y co-ordinate.

item.name: cl_shownet
item.desc: This variable toggles the display of current net info. 0Do not display any information. 1Print current incoming packet size in byte. 2Print information about the current in coming packet and it's size.

item.name: gl_contrast
item.desc: Change contrast.

item.name: gl_gamma
item.desc: Change GL gamma.

value.dsc: Centers the menu vertically (has no effect if you're playing in 320x200 mode, same applies to scr_centersbar).

item.name: scr_centertime
item.desc: This variable sets the amount of time in seconds that centerprinted messages stay on the screen. 0Do not display any centerprints. 1Display centerprints for 1 second. 2Display centerprints for 2 seconds.

value.dsc: Disable rainbow spectator text on the scoreboard.
Enable rainbow spectator text on the scoreboard.
Scales the frontend menu to match the resolution you are using.
Do not display information about all network packets.
Display information about all network packets.
Display that the pause icon is displayed when the game is paused.
Display the ram icon when running out of memory
Display the turtle icon when your frame rate drops below 10.
Disables the display of the frames-per-second value.
Enables the display of the frames-per-second value.

item.name: show_fps_x
item.desc: Determine where the show_fps is positioned on your screen on the X co-ordinate.

item.name: show_fps_y
item.desc: Determine where the show_fps is positioned on your screen on the Y co-ordinate.

item.name: show_speed
item.desc: Displays a speed counter in the top right corner in FuhQuake units (Horizontal velocity). (320 - Normal walking speed, 440 - Accel jump, 450 - Bunnyhopping) 0Off. 1More accurate counter (Best used when LPB). 2Predicted speed (Less laggy when HPB).

item.name: show_speed_x
item.desc: Determine where the show_speed is positioned on your screen on the X co-ordinate.

item.name: show_speed_y
item.desc: Determine where the show_speed is positioned on your screen on the Y co-ordinate.

item.name: sw_contrast
item.desc: Change contrast.

item.name: sw_gamma
item.desc: Change gamma.

item.name: image_jpeg_quality_level
item.desc: You can set quality of jpeg screenshots with 'image_jpeg_quality_level x' where x is an integer from 0 to 100 inclusive. The larger x is, the better the quality of a jpeg screenshot, but also the bigger the size.

item.name: image_png_compression_level
item.desc: You can set the amount of png compression with 'image_png_compression_level x' where x is an integer from 0 to 9 inclusive. 0 gives no compression and 9 gives maximum compression (and slowest writing time).

value.dsc: Allow screenshot uploads to be requested by server.

item.name: sshot_dir
item.desc: Change the screenshot directory.

item.name: sshot_format
item.desc: tga = Tga screenshots (gl only) png = Png screenshots jpg = Jpg screenshots (gl only) pcx = Pcx screenshots (software only)

value.dsc: Only IP addresses on the Ban list will be allowed onto the server.
Only IP addresses NOT on the Ban list will be allowed onto the server.

item.name: floodprotmsg
item.desc: Sets the message displayed after flood protection is invoked. Example: floodprotmsg "Shut up whiner!"

item.name: sv_aim
item.desc: Sets the value for auto-aiming leniency.

item.name: sv_fastconnect
item.desc: actually no help.

value.dsc: Enable high character color names for players.
Enable custom map entity file support.

item.name: sv_mapcheck
item.desc: 0Disable. 1Enable map checksumming to check for players who edit maps to cheat. Note: A player who has edited his map files to cheat by removing textures from walls will not be able to join the server and play.

item.name: sv_maxrate
item.desc: Maximum rate for clients.

item.name: sv_maxtic
item.desc: The maximum amount of time in seconds before a client a receives an update from the server.

item.name: sv_mintic
item.desc: The minimum amount of time the server will wait before sending packets to a client.

item.name: sv_nailhack
item.desc: 0Disable. 1Allows nails in most cases to uses less bandwidth and to fly around smoother and point in the right direction.

item.name: sv_phs
item.desc: 0Disable. 1Has something to do with the table which is build at the loading time of the map.

item.name: timeout
item.desc: Sets the amount of time in seconds before a client is considered disconnected if the server does not receive a packet.

item.name: zombietime
item.desc: The number of minutes that the server will keep the character of a player on the map who seems to have disconnected.

value.dsc: Clients can download game data from the server.
Clients can download .bsp map files from the server.
Clients can download .mdl files from the server.
Clients can download map files in paks from the server.
Clients can download .pcx skin files from the server.
Clients can download .wav sound files from the server.

item.name: pm_bunnyspeedcap
item.desc: This is experimental code intended to restore class balance in TF. If you set this cvar to something like 1.5 or 2, a solider will not be able to bunnyhop as fast as a scout does :) Note that this cvar is optional and disabled by default, so it will in NO WAY affect gameplay unless you set it explicitly to anything but 0.

item.name: pm_ktjump
item.desc: You can change value of ktjump.

item.name: pm_slidefix
item.desc: 0Disable. 1Upon decsension from a sloped surface, the player doesn't "drop" (which is a bug in QW), but smoothly slides, as it was in NQ.

item.name: sv_accelerate
item.desc: Sets the acceleration value for the player.

item.name: sv_airaccelerate
item.desc: Sets how quickly the player accelerates in air.

item.name: sv_friction
item.desc: Sets the friction value for the player.

item.name: sv_gravity
item.desc: Sets the global value for the amount of gravity.

item.name: sv_maxspeed
item.desc: Sets the maximum speed a player can move.

item.name: sv_maxvelocity
item.desc: Sets the maximum velocity an object can travel.

item.name: sv_spectatormaxspeed
item.desc: Sets the maximum speed a spectator can move.

item.name: sv_stopspeed
item.desc: Sets the value that determines how fast the player should come to a complete stop.

item.name: sv_wateraccelerate
item.desc: Sets the water acceleration value.

item.name: sv_waterfriction
item.desc: Sets the water friction value.

item.name: baseskin
item.desc: Defines what skin u see other people using if you don't have their skin and don't have skin forcing on.

item.name: enemybothskin
item.desc: Overrides the enemy quad pent skin so you can define the skin which applies to enemy quads pents.

item.name: enemypentskin
item.desc: Overrides the enemy pent skin so you can define the skin which applies to enemy pents.

item.name: enemyquadskin
item.desc: Overrides the enemy quad skin so you can define the skin which applies to enemy quads.

item.name: enemyskin
item.desc: Overrides the enemies skin so you can define the skin which applies to enemies.

value.dsc: Enable skins but do not download new skins.

item.name: r_fullbrightSkins
item.desc: Determines the fullbright percentage of skins. Fullbright skins can always be used during demo playback. Finally, when the server allows fullbright skins, any user of FuhQuake using fullbright skins will respond to an f_skins request. There is no response by a user of FuhQuake if he/she is not using fullbright skins. The f_skins response will indicate the brightness level being used as a percentage. 0Being 0% fullbright. 0.5Being 50% fullbright. 1Being 100% fullbright.

item.name: teambothskin
item.desc: Overrides the team quad pent skin so you can define the skin which applies to team quads pents.

item.name: teampentskin
item.desc: Overrides the team pent skin so you can define the skin which applies to team pents.

item.name: teamquadskin
item.desc: Overrides the team quad skin so you can define the skin which applies to team quads.

item.name: teamskin
item.desc: Overrides the team skin so you can define the skin which applies to team mates.

item.name: r_aliastransadj
item.desc: Not much is known about this variable except for that increasing the value will cause the player models to be displayed smaller.

item.name: r_aliastransbase
item.desc: Not much is known about this variable except for that increasing the value will cause the player models to be displayed smaller.

item.name: r_clearcolor
item.desc: This variable can be used to change the color for the areas which are not part of the map when free floating outside of the map as spectator.

value.dsc: Do not display renderer speed statistics.

item.name: r_graphheight
item.desc: This variable used to set the number of lines displayed in the "r_timegraph" command.

item.name: r_maxedges
item.desc: This variable sets the maximum number of plane surface edges to be rendered.

item.name: r_maxsurfs
item.desc: This variable sets the maximum number of plane surfaces to be rendered.

value.dsc: Do not print information about the number of edges.
Print information about the number of edges.
Do not print information about the number of surfaces.
Print information about the number of surfaces.
Do not print polygon model statistics.
Do not report when running out of edges.
Report when running out of edges.

item.name: r_reportsurfout
item.desc: Toggle the display of how many surfaces where not displayed. This shouldn't happen during normal game play, only when in noclip mode.

item.name: r_speeds
item.desc: Toggles the displaying of drawing time and stats of what is currently being viewed. Example: 32.7 ms 267/196/ 74 poly 3 surf 38.6 ms 267/196/ 74 poly 20 surf 60.4 ms 267/196/ 74 poly 18 surf 38.2 ms 267/196/ 73 poly 18 surf

item.name: bgmvolume
item.desc: This variable sets the volume of the CD music.

value.dsc: Will swap left and right sound channels.

item.name: s_ambientfade
item.desc: How fast the volume of ambient sounds changes as you move around the map.

item.name: s_ambientlevel
item.desc: Volume level of ambient sounds (produced by water and sky brushes).

item.name: s_khz
item.desc: Sound quality. Must be set from the commandline Example: fuhquake +set s_khz 44

item.name: s_loadas8bit
item.desc: 0Off. 1On (The sound samples will be loaded in 8-bit mode thus making them a little smaller. This will give a little performance boost when playing the game at the cost of quality for the sound samples.)

item.name: s_mixahead
item.desc: This variable defines the delay time for sounds. How low you can set your sound mixahead depends on your FPS, when you set it too low, your sound will start crackling. Generally, with 72 FPS you should be able to use a delay of 0.06 seconds, if you use the command-line switch "-primarysound", you may be able to go even lower, but results may vary on this.

value.dsc: Makes Quake update its sound buffers more often to avoid choppy sound when your fps is really low (20 or worse)
Don't use extra sound updates. Gives a slight fps boost, but may lead to choppy sound on low-end machines

Disable the playback of sounds. Note that it effectively just resets sound volume to zero, but the sound engine still runs. If you want disable sound in order to get more fps, use the -nosound command line option instead.
Disable that the number of currently playing sound files is displayed.
Enable that the number of currently playing sound files is displayed.

item.name: cl_chasecam
item.desc: This variable toggles the spectator mode to eye view (1st person).

value.dsc: The inventory is drawn on the right side of the screen.
The inventory is drawn on the left side of the screen.
The hud display will be centered.
Is just like "2" except it also displays your current weapon's ammo in big numbers.
determine ammo amounts are aligned to the left.
determine ammo amounts are aligned to the right.

item.name: scr_drawVFrags
item.desc: 0Turns frag display off. 1Individual frags. 2Teamfrags in teamplay mode. Note: scr_drawVFrags only does something if your console width is >= 512 and < 640.

item.name: scr_scoreboard_fillalpha
item.desc: Change scoreboard fillalpha.

item.name: scr_scoreboard_fillcolored
item.desc: Modify scoreboard fillcolour.

value.dsc: When you overwrite team/enemy color it will use only those colors for skins
When you overwrite team/enemy color it will use only those colors for skins and scoreboard

item.name: sys_disableWinKeys
item.desc: 0Enable. 1Disable winkeys from alt-tabbing you (only works in NT/2K/XP, and only when FuhQuake is in focus). Note:Windows keys are now bindable (LWINKEY, RWINKEY, WINKEY, POPUPMENU). Obviously only useful on NT/2K/XP with sys_disableWinKeys 1 (and possibely useful in linux too!).

item.name: sys_highpriority
item.desc: -1 = Sets process to idle/low priority. 0Sets process to normal priority. 1Sets process to high priority.

value.dsc: Prevent freeing of CPU when FuhQuake is minimised or not in focus.
Give more cpu for other programs.

item.name: enemycolor
item.desc: Set the enemies top- and bottomcolor

item.name: teamcolor
item.desc: Set the teammates top- and bottomcolor.

item.name: tp_pickup
item.desc: Set items you want to report ($took) Item can be: quad, pent, ring, suit, ra, ya, ga, mh, health, lg, rl, gl, sng, ng, ssg, pack, cells, rockets, nails, shells, flag, armor, weapons, powerups, ammo, all, default, none

item.name: tp_point
item.desc: What to report for pointing (%x, %y and %t). Item can be: powerups, quad, pent, ring, armor, ra, ya, ga, weapons, lg, rl, gl, sng, ng, ssg, ammo, cells, rockets, nails, shells, players, eyes, teammate, enemy, mh, health, pack, flag, all, default, none, suit Item names can be customized with tp_name_item Examples: tp_point powerups flag say_team I see %t!

item.name: tp_took
item.desc: Customizes the f_took trigger. Item can be: quad, pent, ring, suit, ra, ya, ga, mh, health, lg, rl, gl, sng, ng, ssg, pack, cells, rockets, nails, shells, flag, armor, weapons, powerups, ammo, all, default, none Item names can be customized with tp_name_item Examples: tp_took powerups ra ya lg rl mh flag (same as "default") tp_took all -ammo (report everything but ammo) tp_took +gl (add grenade launcher to pickup list) alias f_took "say_team took %i"

item.name: tp_forceTriggers
item.desc: Controls whether f_took, f_death etc are forced to execute even if the game isn't a team game. 0Off. 1On.

item.name: tp_loadlocs
item.desc: Controls whether to load locs for teamplay reporting. Note: The locs should be in your "/id1/locs/", "/fuhquake/locs" or "/qw/locs" folder. 0Off. 1On.

item.name: tp_soundtrigger
item.desc: SoundTrigger like proxys. A SoundTrigger must be terminated by either a CR, LF or filter. The .wav extension is not required at the end. Trigger is a character before the sound file. Example: filter #a say_team I'm at %l ~location.wav" say_team ~location.wav$\me: I'm at %l #a" say_team ~location$\me: I'm at %l #a" say_team I'm at %l ~location #a"

item.name: tp_weaponorder
item.desc: This allows you to define the order from best to worst weapon. The default value is "78564321", which means that the Rocket Launcher is the best weapon (impulse 7) then Lightning Gun (impulse 8), Super Nailgun (impulse 5), Grenade Launcher (impulse 6), Nailgun (impulse 4), Super Shotgun (impulse 3), Shotgun (impulse 2), Axe (impulse 1).

value.dsc: Perspective correction only every 16 pixels (faster, less accurate).

item.name: gl_externalTextures_bmodels
item.desc: 0Disable loading of external 24bit textures for non-world .bsp models (any .bsp that isn't the actual map. Ex. health and ammo boxes). 1Enable

item.name: gl_externalTextures_world
item.desc: 0Disable loading of external 24bit textures for the world .bsp model (i.e. the actual map). 1Enable.

item.name: gl_ext_texture_compression
item.desc: 0Disable. 1Enable reduce memory held by textures on cards that support it (but textures loaded slower and may have less quality).

item.name: gl_max_size
item.desc: This variable determines the detail level for loaded textures. When set to "1", the objects and walls will be textured with 1x1 pixel textures.

item.name: gl_miptexLevel
item.desc: It is essentially a GL 'equivalent' to d_mipcap in software. It has no affect when loading external 24bit textures.

item.name: gl_picmip
item.desc: This variable determines the the level of detail for textures used on walls. You can use this variable to lower the texture detail used on walls thus increasing the game's performance. 0Original size. 1Half the dimensions. 2One-fourth the dimensions. X = etc..

item.name: gl_playermip
item.desc: Determines the level of detail of player models. This variable is useful if you are experience game slowdown during multiplayer games when there are lots of players on your screen by shrinking the texture detail, but this will make the player models more blurry. 0Full detail. 1Medium detail. 2Low detail. X = etc.

value.dsc: Disable gl_picmip/gl_max_size/gl_miptexLevel affect turb textures (lava, water, slime, teleports).

item.name: gl_subdivide_size
item.desc: This variable sets the division value for the sky brushes. The higher the value the better the performance, but the smoothness of the sky suffers.

value.dsc: Blend map textures and bsp entities (ammo, health etc.)

item.name: auth_validate
item.desc: 0If you don't want your client to validate other FuhQuake clients. 1which performs the validation (but you need to use 'validate_clients' to see the results after a 'fuh_version'). If you have 'auth_warninvalid 1' and someone gives a dirty hash in a version response (because they are using a hacked client that can't work out the right response), FuhQuake will print something like 'Warning Invalid Client: playername (userid)' in your console ('auth_warninvalid 0' is default).

item.name: auth_warninvalid
item.desc: Check auth_validate.

value.dsc: Enable displaying team fortress related statistics in the scoreboard (flag touches, steals, caps, etc)
Enable displaying team fortress related statistics in the scoreboard (flag touches, steals, caps, etc)

item.name: vid_config_x
item.desc: This variable sets the width of the vid_mode 2 window, the minimum possible value is "640".

item.name: vid_config_y
item.desc: This variable sets the width of the vid_mode 2 window, the minimum possible value is "400"

item.name: vid_fullscreen_mode
item.desc: This variable sets the full screen video mode that the game will switch to when the "vid_fullscreen" command is executed.

item.name: vid_mode
item.desc: This variables sets the next video mode to be used, any change of this variable will cause the video mode to be changed immediately.

item.name: vid_nopageflip
item.desc: This variable toggles the use of page-flipping during supported video modes. By default the game will allow for page-flipping for video modes that support this feature. For example if a given VESA mode can support page flipping, then it defaults to page-flipped operation. A VESA mode can be forced to non-page-flipped operation by setting the "vid_nopageflip" variable to "1", then setting the mode (note that "vid_nopageflip" takes operation on the next, not the current video mode, and note that it then stays in effect permanently, even when FuhQuake is exited and restarted, unless it is manually set back to "0"). If there is not enough memory for two pages in a VESA mode, or if the adapter doesn't support page flipping, then the mode will automatically be non-page-flipped. Page-flipping works by drawing multiple virtual game screens at the same time in the video memory and then switching among them to display the current gamescreen. Page-flipped modes thus use less system memory than non-page-flipped modes, but require more video memory. When using page-flipping, visual quality may be higher, but performance of the game can change to better or worse, depending on the graphics adapter and other hardware (see the discussion of the Pentium Pro below, for a discussion of why page flipping can be faster but is sometimes much slower on that processor). However in most cases the performance (and thus frame rate) will be increased, but for people with hardware that has problems with page-flipping "vid_nopageflip 1" may help. The Pentium Pro is an example for such a hardware: it is a fast FuhQuake platform, but it has one weak spot, it is by default very slow on writes to video memory. This means that in default hardware configurations, you are usually much better off setting "vid_nopageflip" to "1" if you use VESA modes, so drawing is done to system memory instead of to video memory. Remember that you must set the mode after setting "vid_nopageflip" to "1" in order to get "vid_nopageflip" to take effect. "vid_nopageflip 1" can sometimes be faster on a Pentium too, but not by nearly as much in general, and it's often slower.

item.name: vid_resetonswitch
item.desc: 0Disable. 1Enable (This is a workaround for the bug in some NVidia drivers, when you alt-tab out of FuhQuake and the screen gets garbaged. When enabled, FuhQuake will reset your Windows video mode every time you press alt-tab. Note that some NVidia drivers lock up your system completely when you alt-tab. vid_resetonswitch will not help in this case (try starting FuhQuake with -dibonly).

item.name: vid_stretch_by_2
item.desc: 0Disable. 1Enable (This variable toggles whether in "vid_mode 2" the picture should be rendered at half-resolution in each direction and stretched up to the specified size.)

item.name: vid_windowed_mode
item.desc: This variable sets the windowed video mode that the game will switch to when the "vid_windowed" command is executed.

item.name: vid_window_x
item.desc: This variable sets the x-axis location of the top left corner of the game window on the desktop.

item.name: vid_window_y
item.desc: This variable sets the y-axis location of the top left corner of the game window on the desktop.

item.name: _vid_default_mode
item.desc: This variable sets the default video mode that FuhQuake uses.

item.name: _vid_default_mode_win
item.desc: This variable sets the default video mode that FuhQuake uses when windowed.

value.dsc: Disable windowed mouse support so you can use the mouse in other applications.
Enabled windowed mouse support so you can use the mouse in FuhQuake.

item.name: cl_rollangle
item.desc: This variable controls how much your screen tilts when strafing.

item.name: cl_rollspeed
item.desc: This variable controls how quickly you and other players straighten out after strafing.

item.name: default_fov
item.desc: Very useful in TeamFortress, and other mods that reset your fov when you spawn to 90. Basically, when the server sends you "fov 90", your fov is set to default_fov.

item.name: fov
item.desc: This variable defines your field of vision, which determines how close your vision field is to the objects.

item.name: viewsize
item.desc: This variable determines how large the viewable screen size is. 30Minimum screen size ... 100Normal screen size. 110Large screen size, without the weapons status bar. 120Maximum screen size, without any status bars.

item.name: v_centermove
item.desc: This variable sets the distance that the player must move before the screen automatically centers itself when "lookspring" is set to "1". This variable is only useful to people who only play with the keyboard, have "lookspring" set to "1" and do not have "+klook" or "+mlook" enabled at that time. When the player moves the distance specified in this variable the screen will pop back to the center position.

item.name: v_centerspeed
item.desc: This variable sets how quickly your view returns to the center after looking up or down and moving after that and "lookspring" is set to "1". This variable is only useful to people who only play with the keyboard, have "lookspring" set to "1" and do not have "+klook" or "+mlook" enabled at that time. When the player moves the distance specified in this variable the screen will pop back to the center position.

item.name: v_gunkick
item.desc: Kickback effect when the weapon is fired.

item.name: v_idlescale
item.desc: This variable controls the amount that the screen should sway automatically. When this variable is set to a value above "0" the screen will start swaying in all directions, similar as if the player was drunk of had a concussion. If you want to have some real fun, set this variable to a value of "100" and run around some maps. The larger the value for this variable the more the screen will sway from side to side. 0Disable automatic swaying.

item.name: v_ipitch_cycle
item.desc: This variable controls the speed at which the screen should sway up and down when "v_idlescale" is set to a value above "0".

item.name: v_ipitch_level
item.desc: This variable controls the distance that the screen should sway up and down when "v_idlescale" is set to a value above "0".

item.name: v_iroll_cycle
item.desc: This variable controls the speed at which the screen should roll clockwise and counter clockwise when "v_idlescale" is set to a value above "0".

item.name: v_iroll_level
item.desc: This variable controls the distance the screen should roll clockwise and counter clockwise when "v_idlescale" is set to a value above "0".

item.name: v_iyaw_cycle
item.desc: Sets how quickly you look left and right when v_idlescale is active.

item.name: v_iyaw_level
item.desc: Sets how far you look left and right when v_idlescale is active.

item.name: v_kickpitch
item.desc: This variable controls the distance that the screen should move up or down when the player is shot. Most players set this variable to "0" in order to remove the screen tilting effect when they are injured by a shot. This allows them to keep a perfect aim while being fired upon.

item.name: v_kickroll
item.desc: This variable controls the distance that the screen should roll clockwise or counter clockwise when the player is shot. Most players set this variable to "0" in order to remove the screen tilting effect when they are injured by a shot. This allows them to keep a perfect aim while being fired upon.

item.name: v_kicktime
item.desc: This variable controls the amount of time that the screen should remain tilted after the player has been shot. Most players set this variable to "0" in order to remove the screen tilting effect when they are injured by a shot. This allows them to keep a perfect aim while being fired upon.

item.name: v_viewheight
item.desc: New variable v_viewheight cam be used to get the effect of negative/zero values of cl_bobcycle etc in qw 2.33 . Negative values of v_viewheight = lower viewheight, positive = higher. Can't go below -7 or above 4 because that's the range you can get with qw 2.33 by exploiting the bob cycle bug. Using v_viewheight automatically turns off weapon model bobbing (cl_bob*).

value.dsc: Enable fastsky, helps fps a bit on maps with large sky areas.
All turbulences will be displayed normally.
All turbulences will be replaced by single-coloured surfaces.

item.name: r_novis
item.desc: This variable toggles the use of VIS information from the map data. When this variable is set to "1" the game will calculate it's own VIS information on the fly instead of using the information stored in the map data, this will cause a severe performance penalty in the game. When "r_novis" is set to "1", the variable "r_wateralpha" has a value lower than "1" and the server allows the client to display water transparently the player will be able to see through liquids. This is a nice effect to see but it is not recommended to keep this variable set to "1" because of the huge performance penalty. It is possible to enable transparent water and still keep this variable set to "0" (and thus not experience such a severe performance drop) by using maps that are VISed accordingly. You can visit the official Water VIS site at "http://www.sod.net/" and download the vispatch program along with the patch data files which you would use to update the VIS data for all of your game maps. There are also map packs available that contain VISed versions of the original ID maps. 0Do not calculate VIS information for unVISed maps. 1Calculate VIS information for unVISed maps.

item.name: r_skycolor
item.desc: Change the color of sky when r_fastsky is on.

item.name: r_skyname
item.desc: If you wan't to use skybox name snow type r_skyname snow, disable skybox with r_skyname ""

item.name: r_wateralpha
item.desc: This variable determines the level of opacity for liquids, which requires the use of maps that were VISed with transparent water. When using maps that have not been VISed in such a way, you have to use "r_novis 1". If "r_novis" is set to "1" or when using a map VISed with transparent water and using setting "r_wateralpha" to a value lower than "1", the player will be able to see objects and walls through liquids if the server allows that. This is a very nice feature to have in the game, for more information refer to the "r_novis" command. You can use any value between "0" and "1" for "r_wateralpha", here are some Examples: 0.00Transparent. 0.25Low opacity. 0.50Medium opacity. 0.75High opacity. 1.00Solid.

item.name: cl_bob
item.desc: This variable controls how much your weapon moves up and down when walking.

item.name: cl_bobcycle
item.desc: This variable determines how quickly your weapon moves up and down when walking.

item.name: cl_bobup
item.desc: This variable controls how long your weapon stays up before cycling when walking.

value.dsc: Prevents r_drawviewmodel from being changed by servers like Rocket Arena.

item.name: r_drawviewmodel
item.desc: 0Do not display the weapon model. 0.550% transparented. 1Display the weapon model. Note: Transparency works in GL only.

item.name: r_viewmodelSize
item.desc: This allows you to change the size of the viewmodel (the model of your active weapon displayed on the center of your screen) a little, useful if you prefer to use "r_drawviewmodel 1" and higher fov values (for demos for example). For "fov 110" you could try "r_viewmodelscale 0.8" or 0.85 for example.

item.name: r_damagestats
item.desc: Displays the amount of damage taken recently on the screen above your armour and health.

item.name: cl_camera_chase
item.desc:
0 = 1st person view
1 = 3rd person view ala Tomb Raider (such a fun!)
2 = 3rd person view ala cl_chasecam 0 (buggy)
Disabled in -ruleset smackdown

item.name: cl_camera_death
item.desc:
Camera view above your body after death.
Disabled in -ruleset smackdown

item.name: r_glstats
item.desc: When enabled, it creates a window in the top right of the screen showing the number of particles and etc. in use.

item.name: r_tracker_frags
item.desc: Everytime you make a kill or die, the number of kills/deaths/suicides with that weapon is displayed on the screen.

item.name: r_tracker_flags
item.desc: Everytime you take, capture or drop a flag, the number of times is displayed on the screen.

item.name: r_tracker_streaks
item.desc: Everytime a player makes a set number of consecutive kills, it will display a message showing they are on a streak, when the player is killed, it will display the name of the person who ended that streak.

item.name: cl_hiderockets
item.desc: Toggles rockets visibility. Variable cl_r2g must be 0 to cl_hiderockets 1 work.

item.name: cl_hidenails
item.desc: Toggles nails visibility.

item.name: gl_surface_lava
item.desc: Adds boiling bubbles over the lava.

item.name: gl_surface_slime
item.desc: Adds bubbles and fumes of slime over the slime.

item.name: gl_inferno_trail
item.desc: Changes type of gl_inferno missile trail.

item.name: gl_inferno_speed
item.desc: Changes speed of gl_inferno missile trail.

item.name: r_rockettrail
item.desc: Added new rocket trail types (8-11)

ul.li:
Plasma Rocket. (r_rockettrail 8)
Well, its a blue fireball, you'll just have to take my word that its a plasma rocket.

Lavaball. (r_rockettrail 9)
The lavaball looks really silly with the default rocket trail, so I made it this burning ball of death thing. You can also use it for rockets.

Fuel Rod Gun (from Halo! r_rockettrail 10)
Any similarities between the fuel rod trail and Daikatana's ion blaster are purely coincidental.

Plasma Rocket Mk II (r_rockettrail 11)
Its a red plasma rocket trail, but it has... things coming off it.

item.desc: Note that if you use the rocket trails, you will have to change the explosion colours and things like that yourself. And you might want to try hiding the rockets with the new amf_hiderockets cvar for some trails are intended to be "beam" trails.

item.name: r_grenadetrail
item.desc:
Customizable grenade trails
Works the same way as r_rockettrail, but for grenades.

item.name: r_explosiontype
item.desc: New Explosions types (8 and 9):

ul.li:
Fuel Rod Gun Explosion (r_explosiontype 8)
This is a kind of mushroom cloud... Oh, and its green.

Sprite Explosion (r_explosiontype 9)
Its just a 2d-type explosion for people who don't want great balls of orange fire.

item.name: r_lavacolor
item.desc: Changes colour of lava when r_fastturb set to 1

item.name: r_skycolor
item.desc: Changes colour of sky when r_fastsky set to 1

item.name: r_slimecolor
item.desc: Changes colour of slime when r_fastturb set to 1

item.name: r_telecolor
item.desc: Changes colour of teleport when r_fastturb set to 1

item.name: r_watercolor
item.desc: Changes colour of lava when r_fastturb set to 1

item.name: gl_coronas
item.desc: Adds coronas to some effects:

ul.li: Explosions - Basically just a bright flash since the default explosions didn't feel powerful enough.

item.name: gl_coronas_tele
item.desc: Allows you to turn on/off blue light when spawning.

item.name: gl_lighting_vertex
item.desc: Alias models no longer have the same level of light on all sides. This may not work correctly if coloured lighting is disabled.

item.name: gl_lighting_colour
item.desc: Alias models are effected by coloured lights around them.

item.name: gl_particle_blood_color
item.desc: Changes colour of blood.

item.name: gl_particle_blood_type
item.desc: Chooses among types of blood particles.

item.name: gl_particle_muzzleflash
item.desc: Adds particle effect when firing a weapon.

item.name: gl_particle_fire
item.desc: Replaces torches with a particle flame effect. Includes people being burnt by the pyro in TF.

item.name: gl_particle_explosions
item.desc: Turns particle alternatives to each r_explosiontype on or off.

item.name: gl_particle_sparks
item.desc: Trails appear more beam-like and don't look stupid when they bounce.

item.name: gl_particle_shockwaves
item.desc:
0 - Turns off explosion shockwaves.
1 - Turns on explosion shockwaves.

item.name: gl_particle_trail_lenght
item.desc: X - Multiplies the length of the trail on particle trails.

item.name: gl_particle_trail_time
item.desc: X - Multiplies the length of time the particle bounces around for.

item.name: gl_particle_trail_width
item.desc: Changes width of trail particle e.g.: wall hitted by nail, explosion particles trail, etc.

item.name: gl_weather_rain
item.desc:
Turns on rain out of doors, the density of rain is equal to whatever gl_weather_rain is set to.
If you set gl_weather_rain_fast to 1, you can turn off all splashes, if you set it to 2, you will turn off only the water splashes.
Works on all non-iD maps except death32c, dakyne and some others.

item.name: gl_weather_rain_fast
item.desc: Adjusts speed of rain.

item.name: gl_nailtrail
item.desc:
Adds a white trail onto nails as they fly around.
This feature wont work on servers not running with sv_nailhack set to 1.

item.name: gl_nailtrail_plasma
item.desc: Adds plazma trail after nails.

item.name: gl_nailtrail_water
item.desc: Switches between two type of bubbles nails leave behind in water.

item.name: gl_extratrails
item.desc:
Misc trails that appear on objects that frequently move, such as TF grenades, caltrops, etc.
Railguns in TF also leave behind unique trails.

item.name: gl_underwater_trails
item.desc:
This gives rockets/grenades/nails and other things an alternate underwater trail.
Very nice to have nailgun fights underwater...

item.name: gl_detpacklights
item.desc: A little green light appears on the detpack, and when the timer reaches 5, the light changes to red. gl_coronas must be turned on for this to work.

item.name: gl_buildingsparks
item.desc: Buildings that are destroyed in TF will continue to throw sparks until they disapear.

item.name: gl_lightning
item.desc:
0 - Turns off coronas on lightning beams
1 - Turns on coronas on lightning beams.

item.name: gl_lightning_size
item.desc: Adjusts size of ligtning particle beam.

item.name: gl_lightning_sparks
item.desc: Sparks fly from walls when hit by lightning gun.

item.name: gl_motiontrails
item.desc:
When enabled, flags and keys leave behind a kind of after-image.
Fiends also leave trails when they pounce.

item.name: gl_motiontrails_wtf
item.desc: Same as gl_motiontrails but works for all players and creatures.

item.name: gl_waterripple
item.desc: Put your life vests on, waves are coming!

item.name: gl_cutf_tesla_effect
item.desc: When a shambler is preparing to throw lightning, or a tesla coil (TF) is charging to fire, a particle effect is generated.
